ArticleInfo.ArticleTitle: Study of efficiency enhancement in layered geometry of excitonic-plasmonic solar cell

Abstract.Heading: Abstract
Abstract.Para: The nano-plasmonic effect on the organic solar cell (OSC) considering different materials, thickness, configurations and geometry has been considered. A theoretical modelling based on exciton-plasmon coupling using first principle approach was done to see the effect of incident photon to current collection efficiency of OSC in the direction to achieve efficient light trapping. For the present numerical model, uniform sized silver Nanoparticle were considered to be embedded in the active layer poly-(4’-(1”, 4”, 7”-trioaoctyl) phenyl) thiophanyl (PEOPT) of OSC. The coupling of local electromagnetic field due to metallic nano-plasmonic antenna resulted in the enhanced overall performance of the OSC. Optimized efficiency calculations suggested that there is nearly 1.6 % of enhancement in the efficiency (IPCE) due to plasmonic coupling to excitonic cell.

Section1.Heading: Introduction
Section1.Para: Organic solar cell (OSC) is device which is used to convert solar energy into electrical energy using organic material. It gives an alternate option for harnessing the renewable energy because of its favourable properties like high absorption coefficient, low cost, light weight, and low temperature fabrication [1–5].

Unfortunately, the efficiency of OSC is limited by low carrier mobility and short exciton diffusion length [6]. As a first principle approach, to overcome the problem of short exciton diffusion length the thickness of the cell needs to be reduced but this drastically reduces the absorption of photons in the active layer resulting in poor efficiency of the device. So, there is a trade-off between light absorption and charge separation efficiency of organic materials [7]. Considering the idea to reduce the thickness of active layer to overcome the poor absorption of photon in active layer which is one of the key factors for the efficiency of OSC, several approaches have been applied like using the low band gap polymer to absorb the red and near infrared part of solar spectrum and finally effective plasmonic physics coupled to OSC [8].

The paper is organized as follows: in Sect. 2 we have considered the basic mechanism involving Surface plasmon and exciton coupling for organic photovoltaics (OPVs) applications. Section 3 comprises of the near field calculations from metal Nanoparticles (MNPs) using dipole radiation model, the equations were then used to see the effects of surrounding media and particle size on the overall efficiency of the device. In Sect. 4 photocurrent expression and efficiency of the cell after exciton-plasmon coupling were derived. In the Sect. 5 we discuss about the enhancement factor. In Sect. 6 we submit our findings regarding parameter space and future prospects of plasmon enhanced OSC and Sect. 7 is the conclusion section.

Section1.Heading: Surface plasmon and exciton
Section1.Para: Plasmon is the quantised energy of charge density waves or quanta of plasma oscillation in which conduction electron oscillates with plasma frequency and when the frequency of incident light matches with the plasmon frequency resulting resonance is known as surface plasmon resonance [9]. Utilizing SPRs light trapping capability of solar cell can be improved even at reduced thickness of the device [10, 11].
There are two fundamental approaches which are used to excite the surface plasmon:

(a) The surface plasmon polariton (SPP) and (b) localized surface plasmon resonance (LSPR) which is the non-propagating excitation of conduction electron. The condition for surface plasmon resonance is satisfied when the driver incident field frequency matches with the natural plasmon frequency (for silver 14

Plasmonics is a promising tool in the context of light trapping in organic solar cell. Silver (Ag) and gold (Au) are important metals used to manipulate solar light for our purpose to achieve growing demand of clean energy in coming future [15, 16]. In the present paper we have chosen Ag MNPs (Spherical shape) as a material of choice for LSPRs. It is preferred because of its properties for example low absorption coefficient, low plasma frequency in comparison to other noble metals and economic viability for high scale production of solar cells [17, 18].

The absorption of light in the OPVs does not directly generate free electron-hole pair, the first step after the absorption of light in the active material of device is the generation of exciton (bound state of electron-hole pair) which strongly depends on the incident light intensity present inside the active material. The exciton dissociates into the free charge carrier due to the existence of very high electric field at the interface. The photocurrent generation mechanism in OPVs is a three step process: (1) absorption of photon (2) generation and migration of exciton (3) dissociation of exciton into free charge carriers at the interface [19].

The exciton-plasmoncoupling can increase overall efficiency of OPVs in a dramatic manner. The presence of intense local electric field due to plasmonic resonance around MNPS inside the photoactive layer facilitates the optical absorption followed by photo conversion, which increases the performance of the solar cell device.

A typical solar cell model has been taken for numerical experiment and the structure comprises of glass (1 mm)/ITO (125 nm)/PEDOT (115 nm)/Ag MNPs (uniform size of radius 10 nm)/PEOPT (40 nm)/C60 (35 nm)/Al (80 nm) which is shown in Fig. 1. In this model, ITO (indium tin oxide) is metal like mirror having electrical conducting and optically transparent property, ITO/glass substrate acts as hole collecting electrode, PEOPT is active material in which generation and migration of exciton were observed, C60 is electron acceptor, Al is electron collecting electrode. The roll of PEDOT is that it enhances the electron injection and collection efficiency of device when the photon incident upon it.

The dissociation of exciton will depends upon the optical electric field, interaction of exciton at the interface. The generated exciton has certain fixed diffusion length so that only that exciton is responsible to generate a photocurrent which is lies within the range of dissociation site.When the electromagnetic field normally incident on the multilayer structure, the energy dissipated per second in the layer at any position x is directly proportional to the square of the amplitude of electric field [23]. 5

Thicker active layer having more capability to absorb an incident light photon, as the thickness of active layer increases, carrier recombination rate also increases which reduces the device efficiency. In order to remove this discrepancy; thin active layer is more beneficial because it reduces the cost and enhances the carrier collection efficiency. Plasmonic concepts can be used to enhance the light harvesting capability without increasing the active layer thickness. Section1.Heading: Results and discussion
Section1.Para:
The resonant local electric field distribution around Ag Nanoparticle surrounded by PEOPT (active material) in x–z plane is shown in Fig. 2 using Eq. (4). The wavelength chosen for the field plot is 460 nm and NP radius is 10 nm. In plasmonic systems the particle size and shape plays a significant role in the extinction (scattering and absorption) properties. The analysis of SPRs is in two directions. One in which we discuss extinction properties of a NPs and other which deals with near field effects.The scattering property dominates at large particle size (for example
$$\sim $$
∼
100nm) whereas absorption is significant at low particle size (for example
$$\sim $$
∼
40nm) [26, 27]. Therefore, we concentrated on the LSPR near field effect which enhance the light collection efficiency inside the active material of organic solar cell and are result of local enhancement of the field surrounding the MNPs. This locally enhanced field due to MNPs increase the exciton generation capability inside the active layer, as the dissipation of energy directly depends on the intensity of incident field. Due to the LSPR effects the amplitude of the scattered field has been amplified nearly 26 times of the amplitude of incident electric field.

Figure 3 we have plotted the extinction spectra of different size of silver MNP embedded in active layer (PEOPT) and the resonance peak for 10, 15 and 20 nm particle were observed in a wavelength range 400–700 nm. In the extinction curve resonance position was observed at wavelength range 400–700 nm for the different size of MNPs which is coincides with the plasmonic resonance of silver Nanoparticles. The extinction curve was plotted by using Mie scattering theory [23].
Fig. 3
Simulated extinction spectra of silver NPs (radius 10, 15 and 20 nm) with surrounding medium as PEOPT

Figure 4 we have plotted the wavelength dependent enhancement factor inside active medium for particles with different radii using Eq. (9). The enhancement curve gives the information that as the size of MNPs increases, there is consistent increase in the absorption enhancement factor. Embedding the silver MNPs into the active layer increases enhancement factor in the wavelength range 400–700 nm and we can see that larger the MNPs more will be the enhancement factor. In present case, the enhancement factor is maximum corresponds to 20 nm (radius) MNPs at wavelength 460 nm and the enhancement factor is almost negligible for the wavelength larger than the 600 nm which is consistent with the reports published in many literatures [28, 29].
Fig. 4
The absorption enhancement factor of OPV with silver particles inside active medium (PEOPT) at wavelength 460 nm for NP radius 10, 15, and 20 nm

Figure 5 we have plotted the incident photon to current conversion efficiency (IPCE) of OPVs using Eq. (10). The IPCE enhancement were observed for the wavelength longer than 400 nm, which depends on the SPR band of incorporated silver MNPs.The obtained result clearly indicates that LSPR may induce greater number of photo generated charge carriers due to the absorption of photon inside the active material; which strongly depends upon the local field enhancement surrounding the MNPs.The IPCE enhancement were observed in the wavelength range 400–700 nm, this wavelength range coincides with the enhancement peak and extinction range of silver NPs, which suggest that surface plasmon off course improve the IPCE efficiency of OPVs [30]. In our case IPCE efficiency was increased (in presence of MNPs) by 1.6 % at wavelength 460 nm and particle radius 10 nm.
Fig. 5
An IPCE spectrum of devices with and without Ag NPs (radius 10 nm) and enhancement in the efficiency is nearly 1.6%

Section1.Heading: Conclusions
Section1.Para: In conclusion to improve the efficiency and weak absorbance of solar cell, uniform size silver MNPs were incorporated inside the active layer of solar device. Incorporation of MNPs (silver) results in improved IPCE efficiency which suggests that MNPs plays a significant role in efficiency enhancement. We have also seen that resonance regime of MNPs matches with the IPCE peak and enhancement factor peak. This result shows that luckily plasmonic element is a good manipulating tool regarding efficiency enhancement in an organic photovoltaics. The chosen bilayer geometry in the present paper is an open platform for the future work as we can work in variety of material and geometry space.We can choose the different types of polymer materials and see the effect of various parameters such as extinction, enhancement factor and efficiency which will be a clean guidance to the experimentalists.
